function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"National considerations and geopolitical interests may prioritize big nations over international collaboration during global crises.","Impact":"Lack of international collaboration may hinder global efforts to combat contagious diseases and mitigate their spread.","Mitigation":"Establishing diplomatic measures and agreements to ensure that national interests do not impede international collaboration during global crises.","Technologies":"Diplomatic communication and negotiation tools, international treaties and agreements.","People":"Global population at risk of inadequate global response to contagious diseases.","Owner":"Diplomatic organizations, global leaders, and international institutions."},{"Description":"Challenges being interconnected may require a complex system approach to resilience building.","Impact":"Failure to address interconnected challenges may result in inadequate preparation and response to future pandemics or emergencies.","Mitigation":"Adopting a systems thinking approach to development, with focus on enhancing capacities at the elemental level of the system.","Technologies":"Systems modeling and simulation tools, data analytics for understanding complex interactions.","People":"Policy makers, researchers, and development practitioners.","Owner":"Government agencies, research institutions, and international organizations."},{"Description":"Inclusiveness promotion must be achieved at all levels to enhance resilience and adaptive capacities.","Impact":"Exclusion of certain groups from economic and social development may weaken overall resilience and adaptive capacities of the population.","Mitigation":"Implementing inclusive policies that improve income, job quality, housing, health, and equality. Collecting relevant data to ensure adequate preparedness and response for all groups.","Technologies":"Data collection and analysis tools, social impact assessment frameworks.","People":"Marginalized communities, minority groups, and vulnerable populations.","Owner":"Government agencies, social welfare organizations, and community leaders."}]}
